info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 18 at 2:06PM EDT until July 18 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson KY
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of south central and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in south central Kentucky, Rockcastle. In southeast Kentucky, Jackson.
* WHEN...Until 515 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 205 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding, and it may result in flash flooding later. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... McKee, Boone, Threelinks, Climax, Goochland, Johnetta, Disputanta, Bummer, Morrill, Clover Bottom, Eglon, Rockford, Wildie, Kerby Knob, Roundstone, Sandgap, Collingsworth, Snider, Conway and Waneta.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
